1.text: He, that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.

2.text: When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.

3.text: He that loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth his substance.

4.text: The king by judgment establisheth the land: but he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it.

5.text: A man that flattereth his neighbor spreadeth a net for his feet.

6.text: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.

7.text: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.

8.text: Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath.

9.text: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rageth or laugheth, there is no rest.

10.text: The blood-thirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.

11.text: A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.

12.text: If a ruler hearkeneth to lies, all his servants are wicked.

13.text: The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the LORD enlighteneth both their eyes.

14.text: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.

15.text: The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.

16.text: When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.

17.text: Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yes, he shall give delight to thy soul.

18.text: Where there is no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.

19.text: A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understandeth, he will not answer.

20.text: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

21.text: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him at length become his son.

22.text: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.

23.text: A man’s pride shall bring him low: but honor shall uphold the humble in spirit.

24.text: Whoever is partner with a thief, hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and discloseth it not.

25.text: The fear of man bringeth a snare: but he who putteth his trust in the LORD shall be safe.

26.text: Many seek the ruler’s favor; but every man’s judgment cometh from the LORD.

27.text: An unjust man is an abomination to the just: and he that is upright in the way is abomination to the wicked.
